quiz.title: Unit 5: Energy & Power (Quiz 4)
quiz.subtitle: Advanced Energy Applications and Problem Solving (50 Questions)
quiz.subject: Physics
quiz.topic: Energy Conservation, Power Systems, and Mechanical Analysis

questions.question: A 2 kg object is thrown vertically upward with 40 J of kinetic energy. What maximum height will it reach?
questions.explanation: KE initial = GPE max → 40 J = mgh → 40 = 2×9.8×h → h = 40/19.6 = 2.04 m

questions.question: A spring with constant 400 N/m is compressed 0.2 m. What maximum speed can it give to a 0.5 kg object?
questions.explanation: Elastic PE = Kinetic → ½kx² = ½mv² → ½×400×0.04 = ½×0.5×v² → 8 = 0.25v² → v² = 32 → v = 5.66 m/s

questions.question: A 1500 kg car accelerates from 20 m/s to 30 m/s. How much work is done by the engine?
A pump with 60% efficiency delivers 3000 J of useful work. How much energy was input?
questions.explanation: Efficiency = Useful output / Input → 0.6 = 3000 / Input → Input = 3000 / 0.6 = 5000 J

questions.question: What is the power output of a 75% efficient motor that uses 8000 J of electrical energy in 4 seconds?
questions.explanation: Useful work = 0.75 × 8000 = 6000 J; Power = 6000 J / 4 s = 1500 W

questions.question: A 5 kg block slides down a 30° frictionless incline from height 4 m. What is its speed at bottom?
A lever has mechanical advantage 3. If output force is 180 N, what input force is needed?
questions.explanation: MA = Output force / Input force → 3 = 180 / Input → Input = 180 / 3 = 60 N

questions.question: A pulley system requires pulling 6 m of rope to lift a load 2 m. What is ideal mechanical advantage?
questions.explanation: IMA = Input distance / Output distance = 6 m / 2 m = 3

questions.question: A 0.1 kg ball is dropped from 10 m. What is its kinetic energy after falling 4 m?
questions.explanation: GPE lost = KE gained = mgh = 0.1×9.8×4 = 3.92 J

questions.question: A machine has input power 2000 W and output power 1600 W. What is its efficiency?
A 60 kg person runs up stairs, gaining 1200 J of potential energy in 3 seconds. What power developed?
questions.explanation: Power = Work / time = 1200 J / 3 s = 400 W

questions.question: A 0.5 kg object has 25 J of kinetic energy. What constant force is needed to stop it in 2 m?
questions.explanation: Work = F×d = ΔKE → F×2 = 25 → F = 12.5 N

questions.question: What is the gravitational potential energy of a 500 kg satellite at 200 km above Earth? (g ≈ 9.2 m/s²)
A car engine produces 90 kW of power. How long to do 1,800,000 J of work?
questions.explanation: Time = Work / Power = 1,800,000 J / 90,000 W = 20 s

questions.question: A 4 kg object moving at 6 m/s is brought to rest by a constant force over 3 m. What is the force?
questions.explanation: Work = ΔKE = ½×4×36 = 72 J; F = Work/d = 72/3 = 24 N

questions.question: A ramp 10 m long rises 2 m. What force is needed to push 600 N crate up frictionless ramp?
questions.explanation: IMA = 10/2 = 5; Force = Weight / IMA = 600 N / 5 = 120 N

questions.question: A 0.2 kg ball is thrown upward with 20 J kinetic energy. What height will it reach?
A machine with 75% efficiency outputs 900 J of work. How much energy was lost as heat?
What is the kinetic energy of a 1200 kg car moving at 72 km/h?
A spring stores 8 J when compressed 0.1 m. What is its spring constant?
A 50 W motor runs for 2 minutes. How much work does it do?
questions.explanation: Work = Power × time = 50 W × 120 s = 6000 J

questions.question: A 3 kg object falls from rest. After 2 seconds, what is its kinetic energy?
A machine has mechanical advantage 4 and 80% efficiency. What input force lifts 320 N load?
questions.explanation: Ideal input = 320/4 = 80 N; Actual input = 80/0.8 = 100 N

questions.question: A 0.5 kg object moving at 8 m/s is stopped in 0.5 m. What average stopping force?
What power is needed to lift 200 kg at 2 m/s vertically?
A pendulum bob has mass 0.1 kg and swings through height difference 0.8 m. What max speed?
A 25% efficient engine consumes 8000 J of fuel. How much useful work?
A 6 m ramp lifts a 900 N crate 1.5 m. What force is needed (frictionless)?
A 2 kg object has 98 J of gravitational potential energy. What is its height?
A machine does 1500 J of work in 0.5 minutes. What is its power output?
A 0.8 kg object slides down a frictionless curve from 5 m height. What speed at bottom?
A lever has effort arm 1.2 m and load arm 0.4 m. What is its mechanical advantage?
A 1500 W motor runs for 1 hour. How much energy does it consume?
questions.explanation: Energy = Power × time = 1.5 kW × 1 h = 1.5 kWh

questions.question: A 0.3 kg ball is thrown and has 27 J kinetic energy. What is its speed?
A system of 3 pulleys has 60% efficiency. What input force lifts 360 N load?
questions.explanation: Ideal MA = 3; Ideal input = 360/3 = 120 N; Actual input = 120/0.6 = 200 N

questions.question: A 500 kg elevator rises 20 m in 10 s. What average power?
A spring with k = 800 N/m is stretched 0.15 m. What elastic potential energy?
A car loses 100,000 J of energy braking from 25 m/s to 15 m/s. What is its mass?
A machine has input power 3 kW and efficiency 40%. What is useful output power?
A 2 kg object is lifted at constant speed through 8 m. How much work against gravity?
A 0.4 kg object has speed 12 m/s. What constant force stops it in 3 m?
What is the mechanical advantage of a wheel with radius 30 cm and axle radius 5 cm?
A 75% efficient pump delivers 4500 J of work. How much input energy?
A 5 kg object falls from 12 m. What is its kinetic energy at 4 m above ground?
questions.explanation: GPE lost = mgh = 5×9.8×8 = 392 J = KE gained

questions.question: A motor uses 12,000 J in 15 s. If efficiency is 65%, what useful power output?
questions.explanation: Input power = 12,000/15 = 800 W; Output power = 0.65×800 = 520 W

questions.question: A 0.6 kg ball thrown upward reaches 8 m height. What was initial kinetic energy?
A machine with MA = 5 requires 2 m input movement for 0.4 m output. What is efficiency?
questions.explanation: IMA = Input distance / Output distance = 2/0.4 = 5; Efficiency = MA/IMA × 100% = 5/5 × 100% = 100%

questions.question: A 1200 kg car accelerates from 15 m/s to 25 m/s in 8 s. What average power?
A spring stores 18 J when stretched 0.3 m. What force is needed to stretch it 0.1 m?
A 70 kg diver jumps from 10 m platform. What speed entering water?
A machine outputs 2400 J work with 1600 J input. What is its efficiency?
A 0.5 kg object moving at 10 m/s is stopped in 0.2 s. What average power dissipated?
questions.explanation: KE = ½×0.5×100 = 25 J; Power = Work/time = 25/0.2 = 125 W

questions.question: What is the gravitational potential energy of 1000 kg water at 50 m height in a dam?

scoreMessages.90: Exceptional! You've mastered advanced energy concepts and complex problem-solving.
scoreMessages.70: Strong performance! You understand energy systems but should review efficiency calculations.
scoreMessages.50: Good progress! Focus on work-energy theorem and conservation applications.
scoreMessages.0: Keep practicing! Review fundamental energy principles and problem-solving strategies.
